name: Kepler-357
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-357 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-357 is a star with 0.7250000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.83 times its radius. It is located 2290.30 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-357 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-357 b

Kepler-357 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.48 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-357.

The mass of Kepler-357 b is 4.15 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-357 b is 1.84 that of Earth. At 4.15 Earth masses, Kepler-357 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-357 c

Kepler-357 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.86 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-357.

The mass of Kepler-357 c is 10.14 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-357 c is 2.67 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-357 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-357 d

Kepler-357 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.25 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 49.50 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-357.

The mass of Kepler-357 d is 18.53 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-357 d is 3.43 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-357 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-357, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
